meanings.definition: To bring back into service or use after a period of inactivity.
meanings.sent1: The old ship was recommissioned after years of sitting idle in the harbor.
meanings.sent2: The factory was recommissioned to increase production after being closed for renovations.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy robot was recommissioned to wake up early and make breakfast.
meanings.sent4: The forgotten lighthouse was recommissioned to guide ships safely through the stormy night.
meanings.sent5: The dusty library book was recommissioned to tell its stories to new readers.
